p: Africa hosts some of the countries most vulnerable to climate change not only because of the projected frequency of extreme weather events on the continent but also because of the low Human Development Index and state fragility/failure in most of its countries. Additionally, as on other continents the main livelihoods of Africa's coastal populations are dependent on farming and fishing activities and hence are highly exposed to climate change (e.g., Adger et al., 2006; Matera, 2020).
